content: We'll use this thread for project announcements.
Cross-post for visibility: this channel has details for today's Argonaut Kick-off call (3p ET)
Update: this call has been moved to https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/6855905105082259725 (same time == 3p ET today)

Hi Folks,

Going forward, notifications related to this workgroup will be posted on the Argo Patient Zulip channel instead of through email, so please be sure to subscribe to this channel (https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/227046-Argo-Patient.20Lists) .

To help determine the scope of the project, please complete the survey at https://forms.gle/ert4Ka4ebUeLP81w6 before March 26th. If you weren't able to attend the kickoff meeting on Wednesday, a recording has been posted at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h18HjsPk6Rc and provides context for this survey.

Our first working group meeting will take place on April 1st at 1pm-2pm ET - details are at http://2020.argo.run . Please feel free to reach out via email or on Zulip with any questions!

Regards,
Eric

notes and agenda for today's call

Slides for today's call

Our next Argo Patient Lists call will take place on April 15 at 1pm-2pm ET - details are at http://2020.argo.run.

agenda for call

Please feel free to reach out via email or on Zulip with any questions.
Our next Argo Patient Lists call scheduled for tomorrow April 28 is cancelled we will resume on May 13th to discuss and finalize our project scope.
As promised on our last brief call, I just send out invites to the Patient Lists calls. Let me know if you did not receive one.
After a bit more internal review will post a Proposed scope and API design for review before next week's call... stay tuned.

We prepared the following proposed scope and API design for review and discussion on next week's Patient List Call

Feel free to comment ( if you hover over a line there is little speech bubble icon you can click on to comment )

/poll <foo>

option 1

Unfortunately I have an unavoidable conflict during the Scheduled time for the next several weeks and I would like to propose rescheduling the Patient List call at least for the the next 2 or 3 calls. Below is a simple poll to see which times folks would prefer:

/poll <Proposed new times for Patient List Call>
Wed 10 AM Eastern
Wed 11 AM Eastern
Wed 3 PM Eastern
Wed 4 PM Eastern
Eric, I can't figure out how to use the poll (.. or pebcac). Of the four, I think that Wed@10 Eastern is the only timeslot that works for Sam and I.
OK thanks

Re Scheduling: After some initial input on the feasibility of alternate times, we have decided to:

  1. Keep the same time (Wednesday 1PM Eastern)
  2. Push next week's meeting to May 20th due to the Connectathon
  3. Resume our regularly scheduled biweekly calls on May 27th

Just a reminder, we rescheduled last week's Argo PL Call for this Wednesday.

Agenda: Proposed scope and API design (click to review draft proposal)
updated notes for today's call here:
Rewrote the Proposed scope and API design (click to review draft proposal) for further discussion on next week call

Just a reminder, Argo PL Call this Wednesday.

Agenda: Proposed scope and API design (click to review draft proposal)

5/27/2020 Call notes

Review of Proposed Scope: (feel free to comment and or edit)

  • Agree to include Provide a framework to convey details about the members of a list

  • Discuss merits of discovery using FHIRRestful query

  • Next time:

    • Nominate a default list?
    • Continue Scope discussion:
      • Creation of User maintained lists
      • Filtering lists

Agenda For Today's Call

  • Review of Proposed Scope:
  • SUCCESS!! Summary of FHIR-I Discussion re Group v LIst:(FHIR-27083)
    • “Top Cover” Got the blessing that Group is the appropriate resource to use.
      • Document this use in FHIR R5 to Group scope
      • No merging or renaming of resources
      • Need to clearly document that Patient Lists use Group resource and ignore the List resource
  • Continue Scope discussion:
    - Decide on what is in or out…
    • In
      - expose existing EHR lists
      - discovery of existing EHR lists
    • On the Bubble
      - Getting other data about the lis members
      - Creation of User maintained lists
      - Filtering lists using categories
      - Nominate a default list? ( as part of discovery ?)

After today's call have the final scope of

  • API would allows user-facing apps to:

    1. Discovery of user-facing lists

    - Search on existing list using very limited set of parameters such as "location characteristics" (for system-maintained lists) or Practitioner (for user-maintained list)
    - [? identify a "default list"]

    2. Fetching the List allowing app to enumerate members of a user-facing list
    3. Provide a framework to convey details about the members of a list

  • Out of scope: write (create/manage) a patient list by explicit membership

today's note are here

updates to the Scope Document

next steps:

discuss the concept of "default lists"
Work on the API Design
Notes from last Wednesday's Call
I've also update the documentation to reflect our discussions

Reminder there is a PL call this week where we will continue to flesh out the API:

Agenda:

  • API design proposals
    • Review Patient-List Group Profile
      - With mind towards : search [?and/or operations]
      - Discuss optional Group Characteristics vocabulary ( e.g. location, today, tomorrow…)
      • Review Draft Interactions

See this Documentation for the latest proposals and discussion points.

See notes from today's call

as a follow up we discussed using _elements search vs _summary parameter since the_summary does not include Group.characteristic.

we are interested in whether servers are supporting the _elements parameter today?
@Isaac Vetter , @Drew Torres, @Jason Vogt @Cecilia Wong

Argo Patient Lists Call Agenda:
notes here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1fvb36PLO789YEkj24KrGa8YvacWMx3iRUT3fKVUUDLA

  1. Review Connectathon Issues …

    • More Test Data
    • Dedicated Server
    • Mock up of Q/QR vs “SupportingInfo Extension”
    • Is extra data for end user display only (If so - then we need to rethink our approach)
    • PL at Scale
    • What do multiple Characteristic means

  2. Review of other Patient Lists efforts:

    - Bulk Data
    - Da Vinci ATR
    - Da Vinci DEQM
    - NHSN Healthcare Associated Infection (HAI)

  3. Review Success Criteria

    • Who is planning to implement this?
    • Dev vs Prod

  4. Next Steps

    • HL7 PSS
    • Draft IG: https://hackmd.io/iLbMj3DVTtaNjTsseYAo5g?view
      • Still creating first draft based on meeting notes and connectathon
        • Using HackMD as a collaborative platform to write and share markdown
        • Direct Contributions are welcome

This week's 10/14 Argo Patient Lists call is cancelled. I will be out town.
*** Agenda for today's Call ****

Follow-up today's call:

  • Updated notes notes here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1fvb36PLO789YEkj24KrGa8YvacWMx3iRUT3fKVUUDLA
  • Sent out a survey to gauge interest in connectathon
Our next call on Wed Nov 25 will be cancelled since it falls right next to Thanksgiving. So our next meeting will Dec 9th

I just drafted a track description at https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/2021-01+Argonaut+Patient+Lists, which will focus on:

  • More Testing Capacity
  • Focus on getting additional Data using Q/QR
  • Large Lists
  • Getting Encounters and Appts that defined membership on the list

Feedback welcome :-)

Track Orientation Announcement:

We would like to invite you to participate in the Argonaut Patient List Track during the HL7 Virtual FHIR Connectathon 26 scheduled for January 13-15 2021,
2020.

We will hold a Connectathon track orientation meeting during the on December 16, 2020, from 1-2 PM Eastern (10-11 Pacific).

Project Page: https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=91985576#CurrentProjects-PatientLists
Track Description: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/2021-01+Argonaut+Patient+Lists?src=contextnavpagetreemode

Call Coordinates:

If also dialing-in through a room phone, join without connecting to audio: https://meet.jit.si/argo2020.lists#config.startSilent=true

I have completed the Draft IG for Patient List it is ready for comment and review (and collaborative editing if you wish.)

I have updated the Connectathon 26 Argonaut Patient List track description:

  • With links to the guide for background and descriptions
  • uploaded complete set of test data to both the FHIR HAPI test Server and "Grahame's Server"
  • test is available as downloads of FHIR Transaction Bundles as well.
  • Included several Postman API examples for each of the use cases. for example
    This Example in Postman :upper_right:

image.png

This weeks Patient Lists Call Agenda:

Review Draft IG for Patient List
Preview and Preparation for Connectathon 26 Argonaut Patient List track description

  • Participant list - review survey
  • Draft schedule of breakouts
  • added sections on large list paging, and bulk data/Da Vinci Member Attribution references
  • new section on appt and encounter extensions
  • New Postman Examples
notes for call

In preparation for next week, I've updated the Argo PL Demo Client App to use the Appointment and Encounter Extensions. It is also using the Argo test data on the HAPI FHIR server. If you would like me to test it out on your server, let me know.
If you're participating in the Connectathon track next week, please fill out or update the sign up sheet (and add to the "Servers and Clients" tab).

Big thanks to all who participated in the Connectathon, I wish it were in person :smile:

Here are our summary slides including issues we will tackle on next week's call.

Patient lIst meetings are wrapped up,
The notes are here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1fvb36PLO789YEkj24KrGa8YvacWMx3iRUT3fKVUUDLA/edit?usp=sharing
